title: Haunted by this elegant, simply, no-fuss cursive font! :)
content:
New user here by the way, I’m enthused to gradually start posting more and getting involved with the community here. So many typeface aficionados, NEAT!!! :P :P

Ok, whilst surfing my favourite fashion websites, I often chance upon this gorgeous, unforgettable, easy-to-read script font I’d like to identify and probably even purchase.

Here’s one image:

Any recommendations for similar (or even free) fonts would be greatly appreciated as well.

Thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [co-cursivefont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015110858/http:/typophile.com/files/co-cursivefont.jpg) | 1.91 KB |

 [‹ Type in S, M, L, XL](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015110858/http:/typophile.com/node/50480 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif from http://machinefabriek.nu/ ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081015110858/http:/typophile.com/node/50481 "Go to next forum topic")
author: palebunny

comments.content:
holy moly, that was quick! thank you very much.

thank you for the ID, but also the alternatives— in particular i loved valentina joy and marmalade.

thank you, thank you.

bunny spoons & cotton tails
